other employees can post answers.

380
00:19:23,660 --> 00:19:26,710
And the answer that's right can get
up-voted and people can see that.

381
00:19:26,710 --> 00:19:29,622
I may want this, now this is gonna be
an internal only group I wouldn't want

382
00:19:29,622 --> 00:19:32,685
the the outside world to see it,
or maybe I would, right?

383
00:19:32,685 --> 00:19:35,785
Maybe I want my customers to
be able to interact this way.

384
00:19:35,785 --> 00:19:37,735
I've got that flexibility.

385
00:19:37,735 --> 00:19:40,185
So I'm gonna choose to make this a Q and
A forum, and

386
00:19:40,185 --> 00:19:42,915
they give you little descriptions
here of what you're doing, but

387
00:19:42,915 --> 00:19:48,300
see how with a Q and A forum, topics can
be marked as resolved or rated by users.

388
00:19:48,300 --> 00:19:51,110
That's well beyond normal
email functionality, right?

389
00:19:51,110 --> 00:19:54,186
You don't have that with an email
distribution list, but with the Q and

390
00:19:54,186 --> 00:19:54,910
A forum, we do.

391
00:19:56,150 --> 00:20:00,200
Then we can choose who's allowed to
view topics, who's allowed to post, and

392
00:20:00,200 --> 00:20:01,890
who's allowed to join.

393
00:20:01,890 --> 00:20:06,550
Well, for viewing topics, if I want this
to be internal for my organization that's

394
00:20:06,550 --> 00:20:10,160
what I want, I want people in the group
and people in my organization to do it.

395
00:20:10,160 --> 00:20:11,200
And that's actually the default,

396
00:20:11,200 --> 00:20:15,330
see how it says all members of
the group and all organization members.

397
00:20:15,330 --> 00:20:20,200
But you can pick and choose managers, all
members, owners of the group, and so on.

398
00:20:20,200 --> 00:20:23,720
So you can add or
remove check marks based on what you want.

399
00:20:23,720 --> 00:20:26,948
As far as who's allowed to post, I pretty
much want anybody to be able to post.

400
00:20:26,948 --> 00:20:29,980
That's fine, right, all members
of the group and organizations.

401
00:20:29,980 --> 00:20:34,120
But then as far as joining the group I
might not want that to be everybody.

402
00:20:34,120 --> 00:20:38,420
Right, I might want to limit that
down to only invited users and

403
00:20:38,420 --> 00:20:40,860
then I just invite my help desk employees.

404
00:20:40,860 --> 00:20:43,670
So I want them to be in there managing and
posting.

405
00:20:43,670 --> 00:20:47,070
Other people can post a question, but
they wont be able to post answers.

406
00:20:47,070 --> 00:20:51,740
So it's up to me how I wanna go about that
and we can change it to meet our needs.

407
00:20:51,740 --> 00:20:56,150
You can even make it public, where
anyone can go in and join the group and

408
00:20:56,150 --> 00:20:57,660
then start to participate.

409
00:20:57,660 --> 00:21:01,170
So that's another great thing that we can
do and we don't see on these screens,

410
00:21:01,170 --> 00:21:04,540
we'll see it later, but
you can turn on things like moderation,

411
00:21:04,540 --> 00:21:07,980
where when somebody posts, the post
doesn't immediately go into the forum.

412
00:21:07,980 --> 00:21:11,280
It goes to moderation and
an administrator has to approve the post.

413
00:21:11,280 --> 00:21:14,780
That's a great way to cut back on
junk making it into your forums.

414
00:21:14,780 --> 00:21:21,500
All right so those are the settings
we provide to create this group.

415
00:21:21,500 --> 00:21:24,840
And then when we hit Create
now we've got the group,

416
00:21:24,840 --> 00:21:29,030
and apparently the email was taken,
oh, I must've clicked twice.

417
00:21:31,010 --> 00:21:34,090
So now that it's created, it's
telling me I can invite people over or

418
00:21:34,090 --> 00:21:35,810
I can customize the group setting.

419
00:21:35,810 --> 00:21:39,890
There's a lot more options in here that
I can customize but I'll just hit okay.

420
00:21:39,890 --> 00:21:42,070
I've now got this
Help Desk group in place.

421
00:21:43,710 --> 00:21:48,390
So what I'm viewing now is kind
of like that shared mailbox.

422
00:21:48,390 --> 00:21:51,240
If my end users start logging into
this if one person has marked

423
00:21:51,240 --> 00:21:56,020
the messages read and replied we're going
to see that it's already been replied to.

424
00:21:56,020 --> 00:21:58,710
Now we've got that collaborative aspect.

425
00:21:58,710 --> 00:22:04,230
I chose the Q&A format, so I see Post
Question, but if I had chosen email list,

426
00:22:04,230 --> 00:22:08,390
then I would see Post a Message,
and I could post messages to it, or

427
00:22:08,390 --> 00:22:12,400
if we had chosen the forum one, we'd see
Post a Topic, so it does change based on

428
00:22:12,400 --> 00:22:16,050
the type of group we picked, and
you can change it after the fact, too.

429
00:22:16,050 --> 00:22:19,400
When you create a group,
you've got this Manage link right here.

430
00:22:19,400 --> 00:22:22,480
You've got Members also, right,
that's how we can control the membership.

431
00:22:22,480 --> 00:22:24,720
But you've got Manage, and
that's where you can go in and

432
00:22:24,720 --> 00:22:27,050
start to change exactly
what that group is.

433
00:22:27,050 --> 00:22:32,350
And you got a ton of options in here as
far as manipulating what that group does.

434
00:22:32,350 --> 00:22:36,180
If I go under Information and
General Information,

435
00:22:36,180 --> 00:22:39,610
you'll see Topic types right here and
mine's set to questions and

436
00:22:39,610 --> 00:22:44,580
I can change that to discussions if I want
it to be email or forum based, right?

437
00:22:44,580 --> 00:22:46,493
So I can manipulate
that value right there.

438
00:22:48,688 --> 00:22:50,690
All right, so
that's quite a lot of stuff but

439
00:22:50,690 --> 00:22:53,178
this is what they're talking
about in the objectives.

440
00:22:53,178 --> 00:22:57,651
So when they say on the exam, you need to
know how to Create a group that can be

441
00:22:57,651 --> 00:23:01,569
used as a shared mailbox or
used as a Q and A, or used as a web forum.

442
00:23:01,569 --> 00:23:05,361
What their talking about is you need
to know how to enable Google Groups for

443
00:23:05,361 --> 00:23:07,807
Business and
create a group in Google Groups for

444
00:23:07,807 --> 00:23:12,113
business that then falls into one of those
patterns, it's super powerful stuff.

445
00:23:12,113 --> 00:23:15,930
There are times even with a regular
email list that you'll still wanna use

446
00:23:15,930 --> 00:23:19,811
Google Groups for Business I'll show
some examples in another segment but

447
00:23:19,811 --> 00:23:21,800
many people take advantage of this.

448
00:23:21,800 --> 00:23:26,410
We use it quite a bit here at ITProTV, and
I know that you guys out there will too.

449
00:23:26,410 --> 00:23:31,050
So, in this segment, we got to see regular
admin console groups, and how they work,

450
00:23:31,050 --> 00:23:35,380
and what their limitations were and we
got to see Google Groups for Business and

451
00:23:35,380 --> 00:23:37,850
a brief glimpse at all
the power that they provide.

452
00:23:37,850 --> 00:23:38,842
So, really cool stuff.

453
00:23:38,842 --> 00:23:42,052
Hope you guys enjoyed that segment,
I'll see you in the next one.

454
00:23:42,052 --> 00:23:50,000
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Managing Groups
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,003 --> 00:00:07,987
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:07,987 --> 00:00:13,050
Objective 8.2 focuses on all the different
things we can do with groups.

3
00:00:13,050 --> 00:00:16,280
And it sets the record for
the longest name of an objective.

4
00:00:16,280 --> 00:00:20,580
it's demonstrate how to add, edit,
disable, and delete a group.

5
00:00:20,580 --> 00:00:24,190
And prevent users from seeing
other members of the group, and

6
00:00:24,190 --> 00:00:26,240
administer group roles.

7
00:00:26,240 --> 00:00:28,560
It's really just all about groups.

8
00:00:28,560 --> 00:00:31,270
When you create a group,
you start putting your members in there.

9
00:00:31,270 --> 00:00:33,230
And they're ready to use right away.

10
00:00:33,230 --> 00:00:36,560
And the default configuration of that
group might be perfectly adequate for

11
00:00:36,560 --> 00:00:41,350
your company's needs, but the real
power of Google Groups for Business.

12
00:00:41,350 --> 00:00:44,880
Is that we have a ton of additional
features that we can configure.

13
00:00:44,880 --> 00:00:48,320
We've some of those already in
the other segments that we filmed.

14
00:00:48,320 --> 00:00:50,160
But there's a few that we
haven't really touched on yet.

15
00:00:50,160 --> 00:00:52,800
So we wanna take a look
at those right here.

16
00:00:52,800 --> 00:00:54,140
So let's start from the beginning.

17
00:00:54,140 --> 00:00:56,160
How do I create a group?

18
00:00:56,160 --> 00:00:58,420
Well, groups are pretty easy to create.

19
00:00:58,420 --> 00:01:00,240
We log into our administrative console.

20
00:01:01,810 --> 00:01:04,450
And from here you might
have pinned groups.

21
00:01:04,450 --> 00:01:05,450
Let me go ahead and just remove that.

22
00:01:05,450 --> 00:01:06,235
Let's say that we haven't.

23
00:01:06,235 --> 00:01:10,960
.Right, so for a brand new account, when
you log in you'll go to more controls.

24
00:01:10,960 --> 00:01:12,880
And you'll see groups right there.

25
00:01:12,880 --> 00:01:18,020
Now for me I go to groups so often,
that I usually pin it to my admin console.

26
00:01:18,020 --> 00:01:21,270
So I'll hit that little plus sign
above the pin groups up here.

27
00:01:21,270 --> 00:01:23,610
Just so I don't have to go
to more controls every time.

28
00:01:23,610 --> 00:01:26,560
You know,
it's call customizable to fit your needs.

29
00:01:26,560 --> 00:01:28,280
So I'll go into Google Groups.

30
00:01:28,280 --> 00:01:29,840
And here I'm seeing my groups.

31
00:01:29,840 --> 00:01:33,700
Now if I haven't turned on
Google Groups for Business.

32
00:01:33,700 --> 00:01:37,660
Then what I'm seeing are just admin
console groups and that's it.

33
00:01:37,660 --> 00:01:39,940
Those are the ones that are used for
mailing lists, and

34
00:01:39,940 --> 00:01:42,000
used for permissions assignment.

35
00:01:42,000 --> 00:01:44,270
But if I've turned on Google Groups for

36
00:01:44,270 --> 00:01:47,580
Business, now I get all
the extra features.

37
00:01:47,580 --> 00:01:51,740
So, what I see here in the admin
console is actually somewhat limited.

38
00:01:51,740 --> 00:01:54,740
It's real easy to spot when you've got
Google Groups for Business turned on.

39
00:01:54,740 --> 00:01:56,410
Because over here you'll
have a type column.

40
00:01:56,410 --> 00:01:59,490
So you can see,
like I've got an announcement group.

41
00:01:59,490 --> 00:02:00,920
And a team group.

42
00:02:00,920 --> 00:02:03,620
And these are things that we wouldn't
normally have without a Google Groups

43
00:02:03,620 --> 00:02:05,280
for Business.

44
00:02:05,280 --> 00:02:06,860
But I can take any of my groups and
edit them.

45
00:02:06,860 --> 00:02:10,710
If I want to create a new group though,
I just use the button up here.

46
00:02:10,710 --> 00:02:14,210
It's three people and a plus sign
that we can use to create a group and

47
00:02:14,210 --> 00:02:16,970
specify some basic information
to get that group created.

48
00:02:18,150 --> 00:02:19,700
The first thing we need is a name.

49
00:02:19,700 --> 00:02:23,520
So I've got to think about what it is
that I'm trying to create a group for.

50
00:02:23,520 --> 00:02:25,400
Maybe I've got an accounting department.

51
00:02:25,400 --> 00:02:28,240
And so I want the accountants to have
a mailing list that I can use to easily

52
00:02:28,240 --> 00:02:29,830
contact each of them.

53
00:02:29,830 --> 00:02:32,950
So I'm going to create
an accounting department group.

54
00:02:33,980 --> 00:02:37,740
And I'll give it an email address
of accounting@itprotv.net.

55
00:02:37,740 --> 00:02:41,760
You can put in a description of what
its used for, but that's optional.

56
00:02:41,760 --> 00:02:43,970
After that we've got the access level.

57
00:02:43,970 --> 00:02:48,250
If this is just going to be an internal
mailing, list I can drop that down.

58
00:02:48,250 --> 00:02:50,780
And I can choose to make
it a team mailing list.

59
00:02:50,780 --> 00:02:53,120
So that it will just be used internally.

60
00:02:53,120 --> 00:02:57,630
Or I can choose public, which means
anyone in the entire world can do it.

61
00:02:57,630 --> 00:03:00,228
If I wanna put on my website, hey,
have a problem with your bill?

62
00:03:00,228 --> 00:03:03,010
Please email accounting@itprotv.net.

63
00:03:03,010 --> 00:03:06,230
That's the kind of thing I would need to
make available to the internet as a whole.

64
00:03:06,230 --> 00:03:08,900
Anybody out there can
shoot an email to it.

65
00:03:08,900 --> 00:03:10,780
But that may not be what I want.

66
00:03:10,780 --> 00:03:15,840
Instead I can choose Team, and now it's
limited to inside of my organization.

67
00:03:15,840 --> 00:03:17,280
Whoever is the owner or

68
00:03:17,280 --> 00:03:21,200
manager of that group can invite
people to participate in it.

69
00:03:21,200 --> 00:03:26,070
But really anybody can join, and post to
it that's inside of your organization.

70
00:03:26,070 --> 00:03:28,500
So it's an internal mailing list.

71
00:03:28,500 --> 00:03:31,590
Also keep in mind that this is the screen
that's gonna create the group.

72
00:03:31,590 --> 00:03:33,760
Once the group is created I
can come back and change this.

73
00:03:33,760 --> 00:03:37,070
So this isn't set in stone, we've got
where we can modify it after the fact.

74
00:03:38,250 --> 00:03:40,220
We also have announcement only.

75
00:03:40,220 --> 00:03:41,830
Announcement only is a neat one.

76
00:03:41,830 --> 00:03:47,310
With announcement only, only the manager
or owner of the group can post to it.

77
00:03:47,310 --> 00:03:49,070
So they can send stuff to it.

78
00:03:49,070 --> 00:03:51,970
And then it's sent out all the people
that are a part of that group.

79
00:03:51,970 --> 00:03:55,940
So your members are in
a receive only type mode.

80
00:03:55,940 --> 00:03:57,210
They're not able to post.

81
00:03:57,210 --> 00:03:58,560
Only owners and managers.

82
00:03:58,560 --> 00:04:01,750
That's great for
doing system status updates, or

83
00:04:01,750 --> 00:04:03,690
having email lists you wanna control.

84
00:04:03,690 --> 00:04:05,100
To limit who's able to post it.

85
00:04:06,570 --> 00:04:08,400
And then lastly we have restricted.

86
00:04:08,400 --> 00:04:10,280
Restricted is where we hide the list.

87
00:04:10,280 --> 00:04:14,090
We actually hide this group from
the directory so employees can't find it.

88
00:04:14,090 --> 00:04:17,640
And the only people that can use it,
are the ones who are members.

89
00:04:17,640 --> 00:04:21,690
And the owner or manager of that group,
can invite new members to be a part of it.

90
00:04:21,690 --> 00:04:24,550
But employees can't just
join it on their own.

91
00:04:24,550 --> 00:04:27,350
For all intents and purposes,
it's a hidden group.

92
00:04:28,600 --> 00:04:30,050
So, we pick which one we want.

93
00:04:30,050 --> 00:04:32,420
I'm doing a counting, and
I want that to be an internal one.

94
00:04:32,420 --> 00:04:34,960
So I'm gonna choose to do a team.

95
00:04:34,960 --> 00:04:37,650
And then we can specify who
we want to deal with it.

96
00:04:37,650 --> 00:04:41,290
We've got also allow anyone on
the Internet to post messages.

97
00:04:41,290 --> 00:04:44,560
If I want people on the Internet to be
able to send to it I can check that off.

98
00:04:44,560 --> 00:04:47,130
I don't, so
I'm gonna leave that unchecked.

99
00:04:47,130 --> 00:04:51,450
And then we've got add all users
with itprotv.net to this group.

100
00:04:51,450 --> 00:04:55,140
If I was creating some kind of like
universal list that encompassed all of my

101
00:04:55,140 --> 00:04:56,790
employees, I would check that.

102
00:04:56,790 --> 00:04:58,580
Again, for me,
this is just the accounting department.

103
00:04:58,580 --> 00:04:59,670
So I don't want to do that.

104
00:05:00,820 --> 00:05:04,470
I'll go ahead and hit create, and
it's going to build that group.

105
00:05:04,470 --> 00:05:07,060
Now those screens are a little
bit different than the old admin

106
00:05:07,060 --> 00:05:08,590
console groups, but not too much.

107
00:05:08,590 --> 00:05:10,880
You're really just specifying a name and
creating.

108
00:05:11,960 --> 00:05:16,520
Once it's done we have some limited
settings right in here for the group.

109
00:05:16,520 --> 00:05:18,690
So you'll see where we can
manage the users in the group.

110
00:05:18,690 --> 00:05:21,350
So we can add people to it or
take people out.

111
00:05:21,350 --> 00:05:23,040
And you'll typically want to do that.

112
00:05:23,040 --> 00:05:25,240
You'll normally designate
at least one owner.

113
00:05:25,240 --> 00:05:27,400
Someone who can manage that list.

114
00:05:27,400 --> 00:05:29,220
And then you'll designate other members.

115
00:05:29,220 --> 00:05:31,450
People who might be in your
accounting department.

116
00:05:31,450 --> 00:05:33,280
So for add new members here,
I might add myself.

117
00:05:33,280 --> 00:05:38,480
All right, and I'm a super admin so
I don't necessarily need to add myself.

118
00:05:38,480 --> 00:05:41,620
But if I have non administrative
account that I use also,

119
00:05:41,620 --> 00:05:43,190
I might wanna put that in here.

120
00:05:43,190 --> 00:05:45,500
And so I'm gonna add myself as an owner.

121
00:05:45,500 --> 00:05:49,040
Which will allow me to post to it,
and invite new people.

122
00:05:49,040 --> 00:05:50,570
So I'll just get myself added.

123
00:05:50,570 --> 00:05:53,760
And then I can add any other
employees that we need.

124
00:05:53,760 --> 00:05:56,540
So maybe I'll add Chris Poland.

125
00:05:56,540 --> 00:05:57,160
So I'll pick him.

126
00:05:57,160 --> 00:05:59,010
And I'm gonna add him as a member.

127
00:05:59,010 --> 00:06:01,020
So he's gonna be in my
accounting department.

128
00:06:01,020 --> 00:06:04,330
And when I shoot emails to this list,
I want him to be able to get it.

129
00:06:04,330 --> 00:06:04,910
All right.

130
00:06:04,910 --> 00:06:07,350
So now I've got me as an owner, and

131
00:06:07,350 --> 00:06:09,739
Chris as a member,
right there in the address list.

132
00:06:11,824 --> 00:06:12,690
All right.

133
00:06:12,690 --> 00:06:15,010
Some of the other things that
we can adjust here on the group.

134
00:06:15,010 --> 00:06:16,670
We've got access settings.

135
00:06:16,670 --> 00:06:18,360
When you go into access settings,

136
00:06:18,360 --> 00:06:21,450
notice how it launches
an entirely separate window.

137
00:06:21,450 --> 00:06:23,380
So it's not just settings
right here in the screen.

138
00:06:23,380 --> 00:06:26,320
Normally, you'd expect something on
the right side of the screen to appear.

139
00:06:26,320 --> 00:06:29,172
Here, it jumps over to
the Google Groups service.

140
00:06:29,172 --> 00:06:32,180
Google Groups for
Business adds so many features,

141
00:06:32,180 --> 00:06:34,910
that they actually give you
a dedicated site to manage it.

142
00:06:34,910 --> 00:06:36,490
And I can see that up here on our URL.

143
00:06:36,490 --> 00:06:41,330
That's groups.google.com/a/ and
then your domain name, alright.

144
00:06:42,430 --> 00:06:45,500
So, when working with the groups, I could
bypass the admin console all together.

145
00:06:45,500 --> 00:06:48,210
And just come right here
to manage my groups.

146
00:06:49,230 --> 00:06:52,640
Coming this way though, coming through
the admin console, is really easy for

147
00:06:52,640 --> 00:06:55,830
managing groups that you're a member of.

148
00:06:55,830 --> 00:06:59,370
If you're not a member of a group,
then you won't see it in the group list.

149
00:06:59,370 --> 00:07:00,820
For example, let me show you.

150

whether they can move topics and so on.

370
00:19:28,920 --> 00:19:32,220
We go through and we specify
exactly what we want them to have.

371
00:19:32,220 --> 00:19:36,174
When we say done, we can hit save and
now I've got a custom role.

372
00:19:36,174 --> 00:19:40,508
I've got the three roles that Google built
in and now I've got my additional role,

373
00:19:44,326 --> 00:19:48,730
which apparently is taking
it's time on saving.

374
00:19:48,730 --> 00:19:52,430
So whenever it saves I'll
have a group called VIP.

375
00:19:52,430 --> 00:19:55,080
So I can still use my other roles but
now I've got this one.

376
00:19:55,080 --> 00:19:58,150
These are really neat because we
can further refine the permissions.

377
00:19:58,150 --> 00:20:00,810
If you were looking at those permission
screens a minute ago and going man, Don,

378
00:20:00,810 --> 00:20:01,780
those are kinda limited.

379
00:20:01,780 --> 00:20:04,120
It's real general,
it applies to everybody.

380
00:20:04,120 --> 00:20:08,350
Roles are how we make the permissions
apply to just some people.

381
00:20:08,350 --> 00:20:10,100
Some people get more access than others,

382
00:20:10,100 --> 00:20:12,930
other people get less access than others,
and we dictate that through roles.

383
00:20:15,430 --> 00:20:16,280
All right.

384
00:20:16,280 --> 00:20:22,085
A few other things that we might do if
we want to disable the group, all right.

385
00:20:22,085 --> 00:20:25,480
Maybe we're having some problems with
the group, and we need to just work on it.

386
00:20:25,480 --> 00:20:27,399
Maybe something happened
with our spam settings and

387
00:20:27,399 --> 00:20:30,700
it's just overwhelmed with spam, so
I wanna get that cleaned up, all right.

388
00:20:30,700 --> 00:20:33,070
I might want to disable
the group temporarily so

389
00:20:33,070 --> 00:20:35,050
that people can't relay stuff through it.

390
00:20:35,050 --> 00:20:37,490
Get it cleaned up, and
then make it available again.

391
00:20:37,490 --> 00:20:40,730
So we can make them enabled or
disabled at will.

392
00:20:40,730 --> 00:20:42,940
And you'll see that over
here on the left side.

393
00:20:42,940 --> 00:20:50,230
If I go down to Information, and under
Information I'm gonna go down to Advanced.

394
00:20:51,585 --> 00:20:52,900
And it still isn't saved.

395
00:20:52,900 --> 00:20:55,470
I'll just OK and navigate away.

396
00:20:55,470 --> 00:20:58,450
All right, so I'm gonna go down
to Information and Advanced.

397
00:20:58,450 --> 00:21:03,920
And under Advanced you'll see the options
to Disable and to Delete the group.

398
00:21:03,920 --> 00:21:05,300
Disabling is temporary.

399
00:21:05,300 --> 00:21:08,630
When you disable a group,
it turns it off, but it's still there.

400
00:21:08,630 --> 00:21:11,100
We can turn it on whenever we want.

401
00:21:11,100 --> 00:21:14,390
If we're done with a group and we
absolutely don't want it around anymore,

402
00:21:14,390 --> 00:21:17,170
you can hit Delete, and
that's gonna get it out.

403
00:21:17,170 --> 00:21:18,310
Big warning right here, though.

404
00:21:18,310 --> 00:21:19,445
There's no undo for this.

405
00:21:19,445 --> 00:21:21,680
So when remove it,
it's gone and it's permanent.

406
00:21:21,680 --> 00:21:25,810
So they actually make you
type Delete this group.

407
00:21:25,810 --> 00:21:30,295
Right here, you've gotta type that in and
then hit Delete before it'll actually go.

408
00:21:30,295 --> 00:21:32,550
Actually, this is a little bit different.

409
00:21:32,550 --> 00:21:35,020
They want you to type your explanation.

410
00:21:35,020 --> 00:21:37,350
But we need to type our explanation and
then hit delete this group, and

411
00:21:37,350 --> 00:21:41,170
it'll wipe it out and that group will be
gone, and it's gone for good, that's it,

412
00:21:41,170 --> 00:21:42,240
no bringing it back.

413
00:21:42,240 --> 00:21:46,840
So you could have years of data in there,
wiped out just like that, so

414
00:21:46,840 --> 00:21:48,940
be careful with the Delete
this group option.

415
00:21:48,940 --> 00:21:52,290
If you think you're gonna need it back,
you just hit Disable this group, that'll

416
00:21:52,290 --> 00:21:57,240
disable it and then later on you can come
and re-enable the group to bring it back.

417
00:21:57,240 --> 00:22:00,490
That's usually the better option
because you never know when you might

418
00:22:00,490 --> 00:22:02,000
need that data.

419
00:22:02,000 --> 00:22:05,130
Another option in here is down at
the bottom, the Reset this group.

420
00:22:05,130 --> 00:22:08,208
If you've messed around with
permissions in the configuration and

421
00:22:08,208 --> 00:22:11,502
you've done something that's just
made this group really behave odd,

422
00:22:11,502 --> 00:22:13,128
you can come down here and reset it.

423
00:22:13,128 --> 00:22:17,415
When you reset it, that'll let you put
it back to the original settings for

424
00:22:17,415 --> 00:22:20,898
an email list, web forum,
Q&A, or collaborative inbox.

425
00:22:20,898 --> 00:22:24,880
And it'll go ahead and rearrange all that,
put the permissions back.

426
00:22:24,880 --> 00:22:27,540
It leaves the data in
there which is kinda nice.

427
00:22:27,540 --> 00:22:33,610
But it says here, additional roles may be
removed though they will not be deleted.

428
00:22:33,610 --> 00:22:37,800
So your information will stay,
but every permission setting and

429
00:22:37,800 --> 00:22:39,440
configuration setting
gets put back to normal.

430
00:22:39,440 --> 00:22:42,040
It gives you a chance to quickly reset and
get going again.

431
00:22:43,820 --> 00:22:47,380
I'll go ahead and re-enable this group,
and that'll bring it back online, and

432
00:22:47,380 --> 00:22:48,919
now people will be able to get into it and
work with it.

433
00:22:51,500 --> 00:22:53,910
All right.
So those are some of the more advanced

434
00:22:53,910 --> 00:22:55,430
features that we've got
available with groups.

435
00:22:55,430 --> 00:22:59,230
There's a ton more, if you're ever
bored and looking for something to do.

436
00:22:59,230 --> 00:23:02,790
You can browse through here and
see a lot of different things.

437
00:23:02,790 --> 00:23:05,620
Under Members, you've got all
members where you can view the list.

438
00:23:05,620 --> 00:23:07,220
You can invite people in.

439
00:23:07,220 --> 00:23:10,920
You've got Direct add members where you
can start to punch in the email addresses

440
00:23:10,920 --> 00:23:12,060
to bring them in.

441
00:23:12,060 --> 00:23:13,990
You've got all sorts of
different things there.

442
00:23:13,990 --> 00:23:17,030
You can evaluate any join
requests that might be pending,

443
00:23:17,030 --> 00:23:18,320
people that have wanted to join.

444
00:23:18,320 --> 00:23:21,270
And we've got it set to
require us to interact.

445
00:23:21,270 --> 00:23:24,350
And under Settings is where
you'll start to see other things,

446
00:23:24,350 --> 00:23:28,540
like email options, where we can tailor
how the emails look that come out of it.

447
00:23:28,540 --> 00:23:30,081
We can do custom footers,

448
00:23:30,081 --> 00:23:35,090
our identities, all sorts of different
things that we can manipulate in here.

449
00:23:35,090 --> 00:23:38,390
Moderation is one of the more important
ones and I wanna highlight that even

450
00:23:38,390 --> 00:23:41,770
though it's not in the exam objective,
just cuz this one is useful.

451
00:23:41,770 --> 00:23:45,420
You may be creating a group that
anyone is allowed to email to.

452
00:23:45,420 --> 00:23:49,070
But you don't want their emails to just
show up in the group right of because you

453
00:23:49,070 --> 00:23:51,076
don't know if they're spam or whatever.

454
00:23:51,076 --> 00:23:53,438
So you might require
messages to be moderated and

455
00:23:53,438 --> 00:23:55,990
when you do it there is
some neat settings here.

456
00:23:55,990 --> 00:23:59,412
If you just leave it at the default here,
Moderate all messages to the group.

457
00:23:59,412 --> 00:24:03,230
Then whenever anybody posts it'll go to
the moderation queue and one of the owners

458
00:24:03,230 --> 00:24:07,490
or managers will have to go and approve
the message, before it's allowed in.

459
00:24:07,490 --> 00:24:10,800
But if this is a high volume group,
that's a lot of work.

460
00:24:10,800 --> 00:24:13,720
It's a lot of burden to be
able moderate all that.

461
00:24:13,720 --> 00:24:15,580
So, we might wanna change this.

462
00:24:15,580 --> 00:24:17,620
Notice that moderate all
messages is turned on.

463
00:24:17,620 --> 00:24:22,500
I could turn that off, and now it's
moderate messages from non members.

464
00:24:22,500 --> 00:24:25,108
So if somebody is not a member
of the group and emails in,

465
00:24:25,108 --> 00:24:26,340
they'll get moderated.

466
00:24:26,340 --> 00:24:29,820
But if they are a member,
then they won't get moderated.

467
00:24:29,820 --> 00:24:30,720
It'll go right in.

468
00:24:31,930 --> 00:24:33,740
But there's another neat
little option right here.

469
00:24:33,740 --> 00:24:35,350
The new member restriction.

470
00:24:35,350 --> 00:24:39,120
And what you can do is you
can say new member posts.

471
00:24:39,120 --> 00:24:43,410
If you just joined,
your post is gonna be moderated.

472
00:24:43,410 --> 00:24:47,440
But if you've already posted and been
approved, then you're not new anymore.

473
00:24:47,440 --> 00:24:51,410
Now your future posts will just
automatically be approved and go in.

474
00:24:51,410 --> 00:24:53,820
That's a neat setting cuz
it does reduce the burden.

475
00:24:53,820 --> 00:24:56,420
You're just moderating
somebody's first post,

476
00:24:56,420 --> 00:25:00,040
not every single post that they do for
the lifetime of their account.

477
00:25:00,040 --> 00:25:02,530
So pretty handy thing to have right there.

478
00:25:02,530 --> 00:25:06,660
If you reject somebody, you can
specify what message they received and

479
00:25:06,660 --> 00:25:08,730
you can adjust spam settings.

480
00:25:08,730 --> 00:25:10,960
Now the spam settings
are kind of important.

481
00:25:10,960 --> 00:25:16,060
If this is like a help desk or
a support type email address, you wanna be

482
00:25:16,060 --> 00:25:20,480
careful because what happens if you get
a false positive on a spam message?

483
00:25:20,480 --> 00:25:24,100
Well, when it comes to you personally,
it goes into your spam folder and

484
00:25:24,100 --> 00:25:25,210
you can get to it.

485
00:25:25,210 --> 00:25:29,190
But if the email goes to the group and
it's spam, it just gets blocked and

486
00:25:29,190 --> 00:25:30,150
it goes away.

487
00:25:30,150 --> 00:25:33,160
So you might need to tweak
the spam message settings.

488
00:25:33,160 --> 00:25:36,130
See, the default is send them
to the moderation queue and

489
00:25:36,130 --> 00:25:38,620
send a notification to moderators,
that's good.

490
00:25:38,620 --> 00:25:42,120
The spam messages, instead of just getting
blocked, will go to the moderators.

491
00:25:42,120 --> 00:25:42,710
All right.

492
00:25:42,710 --> 00:25:44,070
But you can change that and

493
00:25:44,070 --> 00:25:48,410
say things like skip the moderation
queue and post to the group.

494
00:25:48,410 --> 00:25:50,390
If you're using this as
just a mailing list,

495
00:25:50,390 --> 00:25:53,130
where people don't actually log
in to the moderation queue.

496
00:25:53,130 --> 00:25:55,170
Then you should choose this option,

497
00:25:55,170 --> 00:25:59,030
which will not apply spam filtering
to messages sent to the group.

498
00:25:59,030 --> 00:26:01,770
Then, it gets forwarded along to
the individual users mailboxes.

499
00:26:01,770 --> 00:26:03,430
And it gets spam filtered there.

500
00:26:03,430 --> 00:26:05,980
That way they can just see
it in their spam folder.

501
00:26:05,980 --> 00:26:08,430
That may be a desirable configuration for
you.

502
00:26:08,430 --> 00:26:10,605
Or maybe you prefer the moderation angle.

503
00:26:10,605 --> 00:26:11,790
Right?
And you can leave it that way,

504
00:26:11,790 --> 00:26:13,020
send them to the moderation queue.

505
00:26:13,020 --> 00:26:15,630
And then they'll be waiting for
you right there.

506
00:26:15,630 --> 00:26:18,230
So that's all under settings and
moderation.

507
00:26:20,090 --> 00:26:20,820
All right.

508
00:26:20,820 --> 00:26:23,200
So quite a few different options there.

509
00:26:23,200 --> 00:26:24,680
Right?
In this segment we took a look at

510
00:26:24,680 --> 00:26:28,350
creating a group,
managing the members of a group, and

511
00:26:28,350 --> 00:26:30,840
we even talked a little bit about
deleting or disabling the group.

512
00:26:30,840 --> 00:26:31,990
So quite a few things there.

513
00:26:31,990 --> 00:26:37,670
And then we looked at some of the advanced
options as far as moderation cues and

514
00:26:37,670 --> 00:26:39,180
some of the other permissions and

515
00:26:39,180 --> 00:26:42,780
the custom roles that we can
create inside of our group.

516
00:26:42,780 --> 00:26:45,470
Actually, I'm kinda curious to
see whether or not mine saved.

517
00:26:45,470 --> 00:26:46,400
It didn't save really.

518
00:26:46,400 --> 00:26:48,300
I'm not sure what happened there.

519
00:26:48,300 --> 00:26:49,820
This does happen from time to time.

520
00:26:49,820 --> 00:26:51,210
I'm kind of glad that it did.

521
00:26:51,210 --> 00:26:55,780
If this happens to you on the exam,
the best thing to do is sign out and

522
00:26:55,780 --> 00:26:56,910
sign back in.

523
00:26:56,910 --> 00:27:00,490
Occasionally, your authentication tokens,
your cookies that are authenticating

524
00:27:00,490 --> 00:27:04,340
with Google, they can get where they time
out or they just get a little quirky.

525
00:27:04,340 --> 00:27:07,980
The more changes you make, and
you can see behavior like this.

526
00:27:07,980 --> 00:27:12,600
On the exam, remember that they're grading
the end result, not how you did something.

527
00:27:12,600 --> 00:27:15,950
So, if it doesn't save that group,
they don't care that you did it.

528
00:27:15,950 --> 00:27:18,980
It just didn't save,
cuz they're looking for what saved.

529
00:27:18,980 --> 00:27:21,120
So if that happens,
just log out and log back in.

530
00:27:21,120 --> 00:27:24,180
That'll refresh authentication tokens,
and then you can go in there and

531
00:27:24,180 --> 00:27:25,410
repeat the process.

532
00:27:25,410 --> 00:27:29,580
You need to make sure it shows up on that
list, otherwise it won't get graded.

533
00:27:29,580 --> 00:27:31,480
All right.
Well, I think that's about it for

534
00:27:31,480 --> 00:27:32,430
group settings.

535
00:27:32,430 --> 00:27:35,880
Stay tuned cuz we've got another segment
coming up that's gonna focus specifically

536
00:27:35,880 --> 00:27:36,780
on the permissions.

537
00:27:36,780 --> 00:27:38,923
So that's a good one to catch.

538
00:27:38,923 --> 00:27:40,187
So stay tuned for that.

539
00:27:40,187 --> 00:27:42,046
I'll see you then.

540
00:27:42,046 --> 00:27:50,980
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Sharing Content with a Group
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:07,980 --> 00:00:12,410
Objective 8.3 is demonstrating how
to share documents, sites, and

2
00:00:12,410 --> 00:00:14,340
videos with user groups.

3
00:00:14,340 --> 00:00:17,010
Now, groups are really handy for

4
00:00:17,010 --> 00:00:20,650
providing the access to resources
without having to do it individually.

5
00:00:20,650 --> 00:00:24,300
One of the examples I like to use is
if I have an accounting department, and

6
00:00:24,300 --> 00:00:28,340
I want all of the accounting department
to have access to a particular file.

7
00:00:28,340 --> 00:00:31,290
I could go and add each member
of the accounting department and

8
00:00:31,290 --> 00:00:34,550
share that resource with them
individually with them but every time I

9
00:00:34,550 --> 00:00:37,930
hired somebody new in accounting I'd
have to go in and reshare that content.

10
00:00:37,930 --> 00:00:40,130
By using a group I can avoid that.

11
00:00:40,130 --> 00:00:44,020
I can share all the various content
I need with the accounting group, and

12
00:00:44,020 --> 00:00:46,850
then anyone who's in that
group will have access.

13
00:00:46,850 --> 00:00:49,040
It makes life a lot easier.

14
00:00:49,040 --> 00:00:51,770
And because all of the Google
services talk with each other,

15
00:00:53,040 --> 00:00:57,160
it really makes life easy within
the Google Apps services environment.

16
00:00:57,160 --> 00:01:03,920
Let me show you an example, and I'm gonna
show you this with a Google Doc, just

17
00:01:03,920 --> 00:01:08,450
a word processor document that I'm going
to create here inside of my google drive.

18
00:01:08,450 --> 00:01:12,430
So I'm going to go to My Drive and I've
got a folder in here called Documents.

19
00:01:12,430 --> 00:01:16,620
If I go into Documents I'll see where
I've created my employee handbook.

20
00:01:16,620 --> 00:01:21,370
I want all of the employees in my company
to have access to the employee handbook.

21
00:01:21,370 --> 00:01:25,841
Well if I want them to have access to it,
I could right click on employee handbook

22
00:01:25,841 --> 00:01:30,740
and choose share, and then I could come in
and I could type somebody's email address.

23
00:01:30,740 --> 00:01:34,690
So I want to share this with Chris Poland,
so I'm gonna share it with him.

24
00:01:34,690 --> 00:01:38,348
I want him to be able to view it,
I don't want him to be able to edit it,

25
00:01:38,348 --> 00:01:40,930
but I can share it, and
now I'll send that along, and

26
00:01:40,930 --> 00:01:44,269
Chris is gonna have access to my employee
handbook, so it now shows as shared.

27
00:01:45,620 --> 00:01:49,130
But then as I hire more employees,
I've gotta remember to come here and

28
00:01:49,130 --> 00:01:51,690
share this handbook out again,
so they have that access.

29
00:01:51,690 --> 00:01:53,880
That becomes frustrating really quickly,
right?

30
00:01:53,880 --> 00:01:55,860
As your company grows,
you're having to constantly go in and

31
00:01:55,860 --> 00:01:57,430
reset these permissions.

32
00:01:57,430 --> 00:02:00,020
So instead, I can use a group.

33
00:02:00,020 --> 00:02:02,890
So I've created a group
called All Employees.

34
00:02:02,890 --> 00:02:05,510
And it includes everyone in ITProTV.

35
00:02:05,510 --> 00:02:09,070
So if I want everyone in ITProTV
to have access to this handbook,

36
00:02:09,070 --> 00:02:13,810
instead of sharing with a person,
I can share with the group.

37
00:02:13,810 --> 00:02:18,730
All I have to do is go to share,
and just like with the user,

38
00:02:18,730 --> 00:02:22,690
instead of a user I'm gonna type
in the group's email address.

39
00:02:22,690 --> 00:02:26,470
I'm gonna type in everyone@itprotv.net.

40
00:02:26,470 --> 00:02:30,450
That's the group I made that
includes the entire company.

41
00:02:30,450 --> 00:02:32,920
Or I could do accounting, if I had one.

42
00:02:32,920 --> 00:02:34,830
I don't think I do, but I'll do it anyway.

43
00:02:34,830 --> 00:02:37,320
I can do accounting and
punch that one in and

44
00:02:37,320 --> 00:02:39,360
now it is going to send
an e-mail to that one.

45
00:02:39,360 --> 00:02:44,070
When you add a group,
anyone that is in the group right now and

46
00:02:44,070 --> 00:02:46,550
anyone that is added to
that group in the future

47
00:02:46,550 --> 00:02:49,420
will have access to the resource
that you're sharing.

48
00:02:49,420 --> 00:02:52,590
And so when I hit Send,
it's gonna send that out, and

49
00:02:52,590 --> 00:02:55,480
it's now shared with all of those people.

50
00:02:55,480 --> 00:02:57,300
So, when I go back into my sharing screen,

51
00:02:57,300 --> 00:03:01,250
I can see here that it's shared
with Chris Poland and two groups.

52
00:03:01,250 --> 00:03:04,460
And if I click on that,
I can see exactly who it's shared with.

53
00:03:04,460 --> 00:03:06,090
And notice, I made a mistake.

54
00:03:06,090 --> 00:03:08,370
When I shared with Chris, I said can view.

55
00:03:08,370 --> 00:03:09,720
I didn't want him to edit it.

56
00:03:09,720 --> 00:03:12,620
But, on all employees I set to can edit.

57
00:03:12,620 --> 00:03:16,490
So now, if Chris logs in, he'll be able to
edit this because all employees have it.

58
00:03:16,490 --> 00:03:17,500
So, I need to change that.

59
00:03:17,500 --> 00:03:18,650
And you can change it after the fact.

60
00:03:18,650 --> 00:03:19,520
I'm going to switch it to view.

61
00:03:19,520 --> 00:03:23,030
So, I'm going to make it
where all employees can view,

62
00:03:23,030 --> 00:03:26,520
the accounting department can view,
and Chris Poland can view.

63
00:03:26,520 --> 00:03:28,700
I'm the owner so I can do whatever I want.

64
00:03:28,700 --> 00:03:32,121
I might have a manager's group that
I want to allow to edit, and so

65
00:03:32,121 --> 00:03:34,560
I can put that in there and
add them to the list.

66
00:03:34,560 --> 00:03:36,880
In fact I believe I do
have an executive's group.

67
00:03:38,300 --> 00:03:41,620
So I can go back into my sharing screen,
and I'll hit share and

68
00:03:41,620 --> 00:03:46,040
I'm going to punch in my
executives@itprotv.net.

69
00:03:46,040 --> 00:03:49,150
And I want my executives to be
able to edit this document.

70
00:03:49,150 --> 00:03:50,920
And so I'll share that, and

71
00:03:50,920 --> 00:03:53,700
now anyone who's in the executive
group will be able to edit.

72
00:03:53,700 --> 00:03:57,240
If I take them out of the executives
group, they'll no longer be able to edit.

73
00:03:57,240 --> 00:03:59,390
All right, now let's see if it worked.

74
00:03:59,390 --> 00:04:01,019
I'm going to log out as myself.

75
00:04:02,950 --> 00:04:05,120
And I'll log in as one of my other users.

76
00:04:05,120 --> 00:04:11,840
I'll log in as Dave, and when I log in,
I didn't share with Dave specifically.

77
00:04:11,840 --> 00:04:15,860
I did share with Chris specifically,
but not Dave, and

78
00:04:15,860 --> 00:04:19,720
he's a member of All Users, he's a member
of that everyone group that I made.

79
00:04:19,720 --> 00:04:23,270
So he should have access,
even though I didn't share with him.

80
00:04:23,270 --> 00:04:26,060
Now, if he goes into his drive,
his drive is empty.

81
00:04:26,060 --> 00:04:29,850
But if he goes to shared with me,
there's the Employee Handbook,

82
00:04:29,850 --> 00:04:31,240
shared from Don Pezet.

83
00:04:31,240 --> 00:04:35,560
And if he clicks on that to edit it,
he can see the Employee Handbook,

84
00:04:35,560 --> 00:04:38,860
he can make changes, but oh, shoot.

85
00:04:38,860 --> 00:04:40,060
Did I make him an administrator?

86
00:04:40,060 --> 00:04:41,270
Dad gum it.

87
00:04:41,270 --> 00:04:44,010
I share with Dave, and Dave is an
administrator, so he is actually able to

88
00:04:44,010 --> 00:04:46,720
edit this document, so
he's able to make changes because of that.

89
00:04:46,720 --> 00:04:50,460
Remember, when you're a member
of more than one group,

90
00:04:50,460 --> 00:04:54,450
you're able to make changes like this even
if you don't have it explicitly defined,

91
00:04:54,450 --> 00:04:56,090
especially when you're
a super administrator.

92
00:04:56,090 --> 00:04:58,020
I forgot I had made him an administrator.

93
00:04:58,020 --> 00:05:00,900
But a normal user would be able to
see the document, and not edit it.

94
00:05:00,900 --> 00:05:03,410
Because I set those permissions as view.

95
00:05:05,200 --> 00:05:06,640
All right, but he's got that access.

96
00:05:06,640 --> 00:05:10,230
So, sharing with a group is no
different than sharing with a person.

97
00:05:10,230 --> 00:05:12,630
We just type in the email address for
the group, and

98
00:05:12,630 --> 00:05:15,380
everybody in that group is
going to get that access.

99
00:05:15,380 --> 00:05:16,900
This is with a document.

100
00:05:16,900 --> 00:05:19,350
It's the exact same for other things.

101
00:05:19,350 --> 00:05:22,880
The objective specifically
calls out videos and sites.

102
00:05:22,880 --> 00:05:29,070
So if I have sites defined and
you know what I need to log out as Dave.

103
00:05:29,070 --> 00:05:31,910
It's not a good idea to be logged
in as two people at the same time.

104
00:05:31,910 --> 00:05:33,270
I'm gonna switch back to me.

105
00:05:36,480 --> 00:05:38,680
And go to my admin console, you may or

106
00:05:38,680 --> 00:05:43,240
may not actually use Sites in
Google Apps but if we go in here and

107
00:05:44,600 --> 00:05:47,485
we take a look at are services you'll see
where you have Google Sites right here.

108
00:05:47,485 --> 00:05:51,085
So you can create websites
inside of Google Apps.

109
00:05:51,085 --> 00:05:54,885
And you can share an entire
site with a group.

110
00:05:54,885 --> 00:05:56,735
So you have to create one first.

111
00:05:56,735 --> 00:05:58,315
I guess that's kind of our big thing.

112
00:05:58,315 --> 00:06:00,575
And you'll have the URL there to go and
manage your sites and

113
00:06:00,575 --> 00:06:01,945
to be able to create them.

114
00:06:01,945 --> 00:06:03,825
And you can share them with the group.

115
00:06:03,825 --> 00:06:07,620
If you go into YouTube and you put
videos in YouTube you can share them

116
00:06:07,620 --> 00:06:11,240
with a group and you can set
the permissions, and so on right then.

117
00:06:11,240 --> 00:06:14,740
So it's really the same
throughout all of Google Apps.

118
00:06:14,740 --> 00:06:19,060
So even though the objective just
calls out documents and videos and

119
00:06:19,060 --> 00:06:22,440
sites, it really goes beyond
that to calendars and

120
00:06:22,440 --> 00:06:26,060
the other different items that
we create inside of Google Apps.

121
00:06:26,060 --> 00:06:29,240
So maybe I'm creating a helpdesk website.

122
00:06:29,240 --> 00:06:33,820
And so it's going to be this address right
here, I can pick my various options,

123
00:06:33,820 --> 00:06:37,300
you know, I'll just do a blank
template and I'll create the site.

124
00:06:38,780 --> 00:06:43,180
And now that it's created, I can share
that with whatever group I want to be

125
00:06:43,180 --> 00:06:45,200
web masters or editors for this thing.

126
00:06:45,200 --> 00:06:46,550
So I can go in and start to set that.

127
00:06:46,550 --> 00:06:50,890
You got your share button right up here
at the top, so I can hit share, and

128
00:06:50,890 --> 00:06:52,970
I can specify who I wanna share this with.

129
00:06:52,970 --> 00:06:54,040
I can see it's got me in there.

130
00:06:54,040 --> 00:06:58,583
But I'm gonna invite
executives@itprotv.net.

131
00:06:58,583 --> 00:07:01,460
And I'm gonna give them
the can edit option.

132
00:07:01,460 --> 00:07:04,100
I want them to see this site,
and be able to edit it.

133
00:07:04,100 --> 00:07:05,770
So I'll send that along.

134
00:07:05,770 --> 00:07:09,470
And then I'll add All Employees and
let them view it, right?

135
00:07:09,470 --> 00:07:14,250
So that was the, everyone, and
I just want them to be able to view,

136
00:07:14,250 --> 00:07:16,610
and we'll send that along.

137
00:07:16,610 --> 00:07:19,330
So, now,
they'll all be able to see this site, and

138
00:07:19,330 --> 00:07:21,670
executives will be able to edit that,
right?

139
00:07:21,670 --> 00:07:24,600
So, not really any different
than sharing with the user.

140
00:07:24,600 --> 00:07:26,950
The convenience is when we
hire a new employee and

141
00:07:26,950 --> 00:07:30,480
I put them in the executive's group,
if the executive group is able

142
00:07:30,480 --> 00:07:34,150
to edit 20 different sites, that employee
is now able to edit 20 different sites.

143
00:07:34,150 --> 00:07:36,970
Because they're in the group
that has those permissions.

144
00:07:36,970 --> 00:07:40,780
So groups are all about
saving administrative effort.

145
00:07:40,780 --> 00:07:43,360
All right, so in this segment,
we got a chance to see

146
00:07:43,360 --> 00:07:47,680
using groups to make life a little easier
on us, as far as setting permissions.

147
00:07:47,680 --> 00:07:51,440
We saw how to share out access
to a document, in a site.

148
00:07:51,440 --> 00:07:53,350
I didn't do a YouTube video,
but it's the same way.

149
00:07:53,350 --> 00:07:56,620
You just use that Share button, and you'll
get a chance to see that, all right.

150
00:07:56,620 --> 00:07:58,150
Calendars, again, same thing.

151
00:07:58,150 --> 00:08:02,240
Definitely make use of the groups,
they will make your life easier.

152
00:08:02,240 --> 00:08:03,430
All right, hope you enjoyed the segment.

153
00:08:03,430 --> 00:08:05,921
Stay tuned, more Google Apps after this.

154
00:08:05,921 --> 00:08:12,589
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Group Permissions
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:08,290 --> 00:00:11,900
Objective 8.4 is demonstrate
how to use groups for

2
00:00:11,900 --> 00:00:15,690
business to manage permissions and
group settings.

3
00:00:15,690 --> 00:00:17,870
When we create admin console groups,

4
00:00:17,870 --> 00:00:20,190
the permissions are all right
there inside the admin console.

5
00:00:20,190 --> 00:00:21,500
Pretty straight forward.

6
00:00:21,500 --> 00:00:25,730
But when we do Google groups for
business, we get a lot more power and

7
00:00:25,730 --> 00:00:29,800
a lot more functionality and we get the
dedicated administrative interface found

8
00:00:29,800 --> 00:00:35,800
at groups.google.com/a/ and
whatever your domain name happens to be.

9
00:00:35,800 --> 00:00:38,570
So, we may need to go in there to
adjust permissions on the groups.

10
00:00:38,570 --> 00:00:42,240
Now, we can create those permissions
At the time the group is created,

11
00:00:42,240 --> 00:00:46,630
that's wonderful for new stuff but
even on that screen it's fairly limited.

12
00:00:46,630 --> 00:00:50,820
So, oftentimes, we're going to have to go
to the main groups administration screen

13
00:00:50,820 --> 00:00:51,980
to customize that.

14
00:00:51,980 --> 00:00:53,240
Let me show you what I mean, alright.

15
00:00:53,240 --> 00:00:55,220
First off, I'm going to go ahead and
create a new group.

16
00:00:55,220 --> 00:00:57,570
If I go to my admin console...

17
00:00:57,570 --> 00:01:01,080
And I go into groups, which for
you might be under more controls,

18
00:01:01,080 --> 00:01:02,180
if you haven't pinned it already.

19
00:01:02,180 --> 00:01:06,940
And I'll go under Google Groups and
I can start to add in groups right here.

20
00:01:06,940 --> 00:01:11,590
And when you create a new group,
it's gonna ask you about the access level.

21
00:01:11,590 --> 00:01:15,490
This is your first brush with permissions,
and it's really limited.

22
00:01:15,490 --> 00:01:17,450
You only get four choices, and

23
00:01:17,450 --> 00:01:21,820
no real ability to customize it beyond
what it's already showing, all right?

24
00:01:21,820 --> 00:01:24,170
So if one of these four meets our needs,
great.

25
00:01:24,170 --> 00:01:27,270
This is all we need to know
about permissions, all right?

26
00:01:27,270 --> 00:01:28,390
Let's run down what these are.

27
00:01:28,390 --> 00:01:29,980
The first one is Public.

28
00:01:29,980 --> 00:01:33,140
If you choose Public,
Everyone in your company, and

29
00:01:33,140 --> 00:01:38,780
everyone on the Internet can see this
group and read all the posts to it.

30
00:01:38,780 --> 00:01:42,520
And they can also post and communicate,
so they can not only just read, but

31
00:01:42,520 --> 00:01:44,480
they can interact with this group.

32
00:01:45,710 --> 00:01:49,360
If you're trying to create some
kind of public forum or access for

33
00:01:49,360 --> 00:01:52,880
your customers,
this is usually a great option.

34
00:01:52,880 --> 00:01:54,510
The next option is Team.

35
00:01:54,510 --> 00:01:58,540
If this is supposed to be an internal
group for your company but not for

36
00:01:58,540 --> 00:02:01,380
the outside world,
Team is a great solution.

37
00:02:01,380 --> 00:02:04,870
With this one only managers
can invite new members.

38
00:02:04,870 --> 00:02:08,410
You'll have a manager who will
control who's in the group.

39
00:02:08,410 --> 00:02:11,800
But once somebody's in the group they'll
have access to post and communicate.

40
00:02:13,130 --> 00:02:15,030
The third one is Announcement Only.

41
00:02:15,030 --> 00:02:19,280
With announcement only,
you can have members that join and

42
00:02:19,280 --> 00:02:22,110
read to the group but,
they're not allowed to post.

43
00:02:22,110 --> 00:02:25,670
The only person or
people allowed to post are the Managers.

44
00:02:25,670 --> 00:02:28,840
So, if you're a manager of this group,
you can post and send messages out to

45
00:02:28,840 --> 00:02:31,820
everybody who's a member, but
the members cannot communicate back.

46
00:02:31,820 --> 00:02:34,750
It's a one way communication,
that's why they call it announcement.

47
00:02:35,780 --> 00:02:37,590
The fourth one is Restricted and

48
00:02:37,590 --> 00:02:40,960
Restricted is where we want to create
a hidden group a group that's not in our

49
00:02:40,960 --> 00:02:45,710
group directory that you have a manager
who controls membership entirely.

50
00:02:46,720 --> 00:02:51,340
Regular members can't invite new people to
join the group only the administrator can.

51
00:02:51,340 --> 00:02:54,100
This is a great way for
creating a hidden private group used for

52
00:02:54,100 --> 00:02:55,969
specific projects or
something of that nature.

53
00:02:58,122 --> 00:03:01,920
All right once you pick the access level
the only other option we really have this

54
00:03:01,920 --> 00:03:04,890
add all users within
your domain to the group.

55
00:03:04,890 --> 00:03:08,240
If you want this group to contain everyone
in your company you can check that

56
00:03:08,240 --> 00:03:09,800
box and you're done.

57
00:03:09,800 --> 00:03:11,560
But if you don't check it,
you'll have to go and

58
00:03:11,560 --> 00:03:13,500
manually control membership afterwards.

59
00:03:14,820 --> 00:03:18,500
All right, so these are the permission
settings we see when we create the group.

60
00:03:18,500 --> 00:03:20,770
What about after it's created?

61
00:03:20,770 --> 00:03:23,900
Well, after it's created,
we need to go and modify the group.

62
00:03:23,900 --> 00:03:25,800
So I'm just gonna cancel
out of this screen.

63
00:03:25,800 --> 00:03:28,530
And when we modify the group,
you really don't want to modify it from

64
00:03:28,530 --> 00:03:31,600
here inside of the admin console
because it's fairly limited.

65
00:03:31,600 --> 00:03:34,599
So when we go in, I can take one,
like my sales group.

66
00:03:35,880 --> 00:03:38,520
And when you go into the Sales Group,
you'll see options here for

67
00:03:38,520 --> 00:03:41,390
managing users,
access settings, and so on.

68
00:03:41,390 --> 00:03:45,110
And on each of these screens,
like on the Access Settings screen,

69
00:03:45,110 --> 00:03:49,470
you'll see where it'll jump you over
to the Google Groups for Business site.

70
00:03:49,470 --> 00:03:50,332
And that's what I want.

71
00:03:50,332 --> 00:03:54,670
I wanna be over here because I get
the more granular control of permissions.

72
00:03:55,840 --> 00:03:59,730
Now the permissions are gonna be set based
on the template that I chose when I was

73
00:03:59,730 --> 00:04:00,330
setting it up.

74
00:04:00,330 --> 00:04:02,990
When I created the group you had
that choice of four settings,

75
00:04:02,990 --> 00:04:04,400
those were actually templates for

76
00:04:04,400 --> 00:04:07,935
a whole series of permissions
that have now been put in place.

77
00:04:07,935 --> 00:04:10,225
From here, we can modify that.

78
00:04:10,225 --> 00:04:14,265
We can customize it to meet whatever
need we have and it jumped for

79
00:04:14,265 --> 00:04:18,045
me right here to the access
permissions section.

80
00:04:18,045 --> 00:04:21,675
But if you came about through the actual
group screen, you go into your group

81
00:04:21,675 --> 00:04:26,175
settings, and then you go under
Permissions, and Access permissions.

82
00:04:26,175 --> 00:04:28,987
And here's where we can tweak who's
allowed to contact the owner,

83
00:04:28,987 --> 00:04:31,820
who is allowed to view the member list and

84
00:04:31,820 --> 00:04:36,250
who's allowed to view the member emails
and lastly who's allowed to view topics.

85
00:04:36,250 --> 00:04:38,470
Just who's allowed to read
stuff that's even in here.

86
00:04:38,470 --> 00:04:41,778
And when you drop these lists down,
you'll see your choices.

87
00:04:41,778 --> 00:04:44,960
Do we wanna allow public or
just members of the group or

88
00:04:44,960 --> 00:04:46,500
just managers of the group.

89
00:04:46,500 --> 00:04:47,760
And you can customize that,

90
00:04:47,760 --> 00:04:51,490
each one of these giving you
the option to filter that access.

91
00:04:51,490 --> 00:04:54,230
All right, and you just put check
marks by the ones that you want or

92
00:04:54,230 --> 00:04:56,350
you remove check marks by
the ones that you don't want.

93
00:04:57,950 --> 00:05:02,260
All right, now these permissions
just accessing the group.

94
00:05:02,260 --> 00:05:04,680
But there's a lot more
than just accessing.

95
00:05:04,680 --> 00:05:08,410
For example, posting,
who's allowed to post?

96
00:05:08,410 --> 00:05:10,860
Oh and I didn't save my changes but
I'll just hit OK.

97
00:05:10,860 --> 00:05:12,930
So here's who's allowed to post and

98
00:05:12,930 --> 00:05:17,480
when we look, you can find who's allowed
to assign topics, or attach files,

99
00:05:17,480 --> 00:05:21,530
have custom profiles, but
post is the one I'm looking for.

100
00:05:21,530 --> 00:05:24,390
And I can see on this
group it's set to public.

101
00:05:24,390 --> 00:05:29,030
Anyone in the world can send
an e-mail to sales@itprotv.net,

102
00:05:29,030 --> 00:05:32,640
my sales group,
because I've got post set to public.

103
00:05:32,640 --> 00:05:36,200
If I want this to be internal
only I can change that, and

104
00:05:36,200 --> 00:05:40,760
I can remove public and leave it
like this, all organization members.

105
00:05:40,760 --> 00:05:45,330
Now anybody in my Google apps organization
can email into this list, but

106
00:05:45,330 --> 00:05:46,250
no one else can.

107
00:05:46,250 --> 00:05:50,240
Nobody outside or we can go through and
start to tweet this even more in the same

108
00:05:50,240 --> 00:05:55,040
members of the group and if the manager
is controlling membership we now dictate

109
00:05:55,040 --> 00:05:59,660
who is allowed to get these messages user
by user as we put them in this group.

110
00:05:59,660 --> 00:06:01,120
So, real powerful stuff there.

111
00:06:01,120 --> 00:06:05,140
You'll see other options in here like
being able to post as the group,

112
00:06:05,140 --> 00:06:10,780
replying to an author, reply to a post
that was made, we have attaching files,

113
00:06:10,780 --> 00:06:14,560
assigning a topic to another user,
that's useful in a Q&A form.

114
00:06:14,560 --> 00:06:17,810
Somebody posts a question you can
assign it to somebody to answer.

115
00:06:17,810 --> 00:06:21,110
You'll see where you can figure
each of these different options.

116
00:06:21,110 --> 00:06:25,310
The default options may be different here
based on the settings you chose when you

117
00:06:25,310 --> 00:06:29,020
created that group, so don't assume
it's always gonna be set the same way.

118
00:06:29,020 --> 00:06:31,769
Verify your settings and make sure
they're set the way that you need them.

119
00:06:33,980 --> 00:06:37,050
Moderation is another thing that
we might choose to configure.

120
00:06:37,050 --> 00:06:38,470
With moderation this is where we say,

121
00:06:38,470 --> 00:06:41,840
if somebody posts don't send
it to everybody right away.

122
00:06:41,840 --> 00:06:47,480
Stick it in a moderation queue and let
a manager approve or reject the message.

123
00:06:47,480 --> 00:06:50,350
All right, you may or
may not want moderation.

124
00:06:50,350 --> 00:06:51,110
When you look in here,

125
00:06:51,110 --> 00:06:55,050
you'll see where you can choose
who's allowed to approve the posts.

126
00:06:55,050 --> 00:06:58,420
But down here you'll be able
to manipulate whether or

127
00:06:58,420 --> 00:07:00,770
not we're actually doing the moderation.

128
00:07:00,770 --> 00:07:04,350
So there's a ton of different
